item.title: Help on Two things
item.dc:creator: @antcolony3 antcolony3
item.description:
@antcolony3 wrote:

ok changing starting out items
Ok open Player.java NOT PLAYERHANDLER
player.java
search for this

playerEquipment[playerHat]

that should start where you find your starting items. scroll down abit. HOORAY YOU FOUND IT
now edit it and compile. CONGRATZ UCHANEGEDSTARTING ITMESW00T!!![br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 02, 2009, 10:34:56 pm[/size][hr]plz tell me if it worked!!! bass is 474…ya idk why nobody uses it. it was my favoite. If they had 474 with GE@ omg

item.title: Help on Two things
item.dc:creator: @antcolony3 antcolony3
item.description:
@antcolony3 wrote:

ok. this is like spoon feading omg…but i just learned a bunch a stuff, and so here it goes.
When you open client.java, search for Dummy. Like a message. “you hit the dummy and receive attack experience”. don’t search for that but I hope you get the point. Alright you could also search for the number of the level. For example, Attack is 0. Slayer is 18. So if i wanted level 99 as soon as i hit dummy, i would do this case 823: if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You have recieved atk and slayer xp for hitting dummy!!!!"); setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((1400000000*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((1400000000*playerLevel[18]), 18); } break;
see? atk xp is 0, and slayer is 18, both have 1400000000, well its close to that for lvl 99. it starts wiht 14 and has a couple of zeros. So ya, there you go. You can also do that with others. Just so you are satisfied, here are some other levels you might fight important.

Atk = 0
Str = 2
I"M NOTSURE BUT I THINK HP = 3
Pray i also think… is 5.
Alright pm me if u need more…actually get on bass-scape i don’t get on mopar forums much

Read full topic
